benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered: Valid Request: Scenarios TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04 cover successful updates with various payload sizes and headers.
Authorization: TC12 covers missing/invalid authentication token.
Non-Existing Resource / Invalid Input: TC06 (invalid accountId) and TC07 (non-existent account) cover invalid identifiers and missing resources.
Validation: TC10 (malformed JSON), TC11 (invalid CustomField schema), TC21 (security invalid input), TC20 (SQL injection), TC22 (XSS) cover input validation and basic security checks.
Error Handling: TC08 (missing required header) and TC09 (missing request body) demonstrate 400 responses for client errors.
Server/Dependency Issues: TC13 (server unavailable) and TC14 (dependency service failure) test 503 and 502 responses.
Edge Cases: TC15 (empty array clears fields), TC16 (max field values/lengths), TC17 (extra properties ignored), TC18 (mixed valid/invalid), TC19 (timeout).
Performance/Scalability: TC04 (large array), TC25 (concurrent requests), TC26 (large payload near limit).
Integration: TC27 (dependent audit logs) and TC28 (external reporting system) cover integration points.
gaps: Partial Update: No explicit test for partial updates being rejected or allowed (guideline mentions partial updates should be rejected unless allowed).
Concurrency: While TC25 ensures concurrency in general, there is no explicit test for race conditions updating the same accountFields simultaneously.
Caching Behavior: No tests to verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Pagination: No tests addressing pagination (not typically relevant for PUT with a single resource, but guideline mentions pagination for large datasets).
Rate Limiting: No tests for rate limiting/throttling on PUT /customFields.
Regression/Backward Compatibility: While there are some regression-focused tests (TC24), broader regression coverage for API client compatibility scenarios could be improved.
recommendations: Add a dedicated Partial Update test to confirm updates are rejected if only a subset of fields is provided (or validated as allowed, per API design).
Introduce an explicit concurrency/race-condition test updating the same account’s custom fields from parallel requests to verify consistency.
Add tests for caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) to confirm proper caching semantics and invalidation.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling under high load.
Expand regression tests to cover more backward-compatibility scenarios and ensure no unintended changes in behavior across API versions.
